text: Iron is particularly important during pregnancy. Pregnant women need about 27 mg of iron daily. Good sources include lean red meat, poultry, fish, iron-fortified cereals, beans, and spinach.
Folate is crucial for preventing neural tube defects. Pregnant women should consume 600-800 mcg of folate daily. Sources include leafy greens, fortified cereals, beans, and citrus fruits.

Calcium is essential for developing the baby's bones and teeth. Pregnant women need 1,000 mg of calcium daily. Sources include dairy products, fortified plant milks, leafy greens, and calcium-set tofu.
Protein needs increase during pregnancy. Aim for 75-100g daily. Good sources include lean meats, poultry, fish, eggs, dairy, legumes, and tofu.
Omega-3 fatty acids support the baby's brain and eye development. Sources include fatty fish (salmon, sardines), walnuts, chia seeds, and flaxseeds.
